Dialogue.Page: Surfing really brings me at peace...

DialogueOption.Text: Is there anything else to explore here?
Do you know anything about this planet's moon?
You remind me of my friend Gabbro who's always calm and zen.

Dialogue.Page: You going to get off my raft yet?

DialogueOption.Text: Is there anything else to explore here?
Do you know anything about this planet's moon?
You remind me of my friend Gabbro who's always calm and zen.

Dialogue.Page: There's quite a few things actually, other than myself.
The water here's not safe to swim in, because it can shock you.
There's the tornadoes, which throw small objects in the air. The ones going clockwise are safe, but the counter-clockwise one will send you to a painful death.
Aside from the dangers, there's my camp, some storm shelters, and a lab on one of the islands. I've never bothered to check it, though.
That crazy inferno? Never been, although I did hear there was another lab up there...

DialogueOption.Text: I found the lab! It was a thermal lab studying time and the atmosphere of the planet.

Dialogue.Page: Interesting...time dilation and thermal technology. I wonder why they would be researching that?
I'm nothing like your friend Gabbro. I'm always so anxious, furious, and squirmy, so I have to take all my anger out by doing this.

DialogueOption.Text: Plus you're not trapped in a time loop with me....

Dialogue.Page: Time loop? What kind of nonsense are you talking about?
Next time, don't bother me on my raft! I'm already mad about our star dying soon!
